messages.content: ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader is a custom node of ComfyUI that downloads and loads models from the input URL. The model is temporarily downloaded into memory and not saved to storage.
ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader is useful when trying out models or when using various models on machines with limited storage.

ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader can be installed by using 'git clone https://github.com/pkpkTech/ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader' in your ComfyUI custom_nodes directory and 'pip install -r requirements.txt' in ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader directory.
What nodes are added by ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader?
ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader adds 'Load Checkpoint (Temporary)' and 'Load LoRA (Temporary)' nodes to the temporary_loader category.
What additional parameters are added to the Load node in ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader?
ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader adds ckpt_url, ckpt_type, and download_split as additional parameters to the Load node.
Can multiple LoRAs be loaded using ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader?
Yes, a 'Load Multi LoRA (Temporary)' node is added to load multiple LoRAs.
How to specify strength_model, strength_clip, ckpt_type in ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader?
These can be specified in text format, e.g., `{strength_model}:{strength_clip}:{LoRA URL} or file:{LoRA file name}`.
Can comments be added to LoRAs in ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader?
Yes, comments can be added to LoRAs in ComfyUI-TemporaryLoader. They should start the line with `#`.
